info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 3:47PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Claiborne to near Richwood. Movement was northeast at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Fairbanks, Loch Lomon, Richwood, Monroe, Spencer, Millhaven, Sterlington, Rocky Branch, Pine Grove, West Monroe, Deshard, Brownsville-Bawcom, Swartz, Claiborne, and Brownsville-Bawcomville.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
